intro: Metastelma purpurascens, commonly known as the red-stemmed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and typically grows on the branches of host trees such as those in the genus *Erythroxylum*. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually arranged in opposite pairs along its stem. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are borne in clusters, while its berries are small and often brightly colored. Metastelma purpurascens plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various birds and insects.
